backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor implementing the student feedback system with student/submission/feedback management, instructor CRUD with PIN verification, system analytics, and submission notes. Uses persistent Maps and Sets with migration support.
backend/migration.mo: Migration module that transforms the old actor state (without instructors or submission notes) into the new actor state by preserving existing data and initializing empty maps for the new instructor and notes fields.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping implemented features (instructor login gate, system analytics, instructor notes, manage instructors) to their source files, component dependencies, and test IDs with confidence ratings.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON document containing one-sentence summaries of every frontend source file, serving as a quick reference for the purpose and styling approach of each component, page, hook, and config file.
frontend/index.css: Global CSS entry point that applies Tailwind base/components/utilities and defines OKLCH-based CSS custom properties for light and dark theme color tokens used throughout the UI.
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML shell that sets the page title to 'Anurag University Student Feedback System' and mounts the React app via the /src/main.tsx module script.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component that sets up TanStack Router with four routes (home, submit, dashboard, admin), wraps page transitions in an AnimatedPage fade-slide effect, and renders the shared Navigation/Footer layout with a Sonner Toaster.
frontend/src/components/AddInstructorFor: A form component for adding a new instructor with fields for name, email, department, and PIN, using the useAddInstructor mutation hook and displaying success/error messages.
frontend/src/components/AddStudentForm.t: A card-based form component for adding a new student with name, student ID, and course fields, using the useAddStudent mutation hook with inline success/error feedback.
frontend/src/components/FeatureCard.tsx: A presentational card component that displays a Lucide icon, title, and description with hover animations and optional entrance animation delay.
Displays AI-generated feedback including a scored badge with label, feedback text, and a list of improvement suggestions with staggered slide-in animations.
frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx: A site footer with brand logo, navigation links, an about blurb, copyright year, and a caffeine.ai attribution link.
Renders a table of instructors with name, ID, email, department, and a delete button per row using the useDeleteInstructor mutation hook; shows an empty state when no instructors exist.
frontend/src/components/Navigation.tsx: A fixed top navigation bar with the Anurag University logo, desktop nav links with active-state highlighting, scroll-based shadow, and a collapsible mobile menu.
frontend/src/components/ScoreDistributio: Renders an animated horizontal bar chart showing the distribution of feedback scores across five buckets (0–20, 21–40, etc.), using IntersectionObserver to trigger entrance animations. Displays an empty state when no feedbacks are provided.
frontend/src/components/StudentTable.tsx: Displays a table of registered students with their ID, course, submission count, and average score fetched per-row via useGetStudentStats. Provides View and Delete action buttons for each student row.
frontend/src/components/SubmissionCard.t: Renders a collapsible card for a single student submission, showing assignment title, date, and optionally AI-generated feedback via FeedbackDisplay. Includes an InstructorNotes sub-component that loads and saves per-submission instructor notes.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor (authenticated or anonymous) using React Query, keyed on the current Internet Identity principal. Invalidates and refetches all non-actor queries whenever the actor instance changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an InternetIdentityProvider context and useInternetIdentity hook for managing ICP Internet Identity authentication, including login, logout, and persisting identity across page reloads via AuthClient.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Centralizes all React Query hooks for the backend actor, covering CRUD operations for students, submissions, feedback generation, student stats, and instructor authentication/notes.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet that imports Inter and Playfair Display fonts, sets up Tailwind layers, and defines Anurag University brand CSS variables (red/navy palette) for both light and dark modes, plus utility classes and keyframe animations.
frontend/src/main.tsx: React app entry point that mounts the root component wrapped with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/src/pages/Home.tsx: Landing page component featuring an animated hero section, a stats section with count-up animations, and a features section showcasing Easy Submission, AI-Powered Feedback, and Track Progress cards.
frontend/src/pages/InstructorPanel.tsx: Instructor panel page with a PIN-based login form and, once authenticated, a tabbed dashboard for managing students, instructors, viewing submissions, and a score distribution chart.
frontend/src/pages/StudentDashboard.tsx: Student dashboard page that lets a student look up their submissions and AI-generated feedback by student ID, displaying stat cards and a list of submission cards with feedback.
frontend/src/pages/StudentSubmission.tsx: Assignment submission page where students enter their ID, assignment title, and text, then trigger backend calls to create a submission and generate AI feedback displayed via FeedbackDisplay.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration for the frontend, extending the default theme with custom OKLCH-based color tokens (including Anurag University brand colors), custom fonts, border radii, box shadows, and keyframe animations.
project_state.json: Project state manifest (version 11) describing the AI-enhanced student feedback system for Anurag University, listing existing features, architectural notes, requirements, and implementation status for all major pages and components.
